bestBHT.bht: Someone greater than Solomon and the queen of the South will rise up in judgment with the men of this generation. This more that will rise is something beyond what has been seen before, surpassing both the wisdom of Solomon and the fame of the queen. This generation had the opportunity to hear not just natural or moral wisdom, but also spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus himself, making their condemnation even greater.

Marvin Vincent: Shall rise up [εγερθησεται] . From the dead.
A greater [πλειον] . Lit., something more. See on Matthew 12:6. Wyc., here is more than Solomon.
Philip Schaff: Luke 11:31. More. The sign to this generation is more than what attracted the queen of the south, etc.
Archibald T. Robertson: With the men of this generation (μετα των ανδρων της γενεας ταυτης). Here Matthew 12:42 has simply "with this generation," which see.
John Gill: She shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them.
Her conduct would be brought as an evidence against them, and be improved as an aggravation of their condemnation.

She came to hear only natural or moral wisdom, but they might have heard spiritual and heavenly wisdom, with which eternal happiness is connected; she came to hear only a mere man, but they might have heard him who is the wisdom of God, and the only wise God, and our Saviour.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Luke 11:31, Jesus mentions that someone greater than Solomon and the queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them. This more that will rise up is something greater than anything seen before, as it surpasses both the wisdom of Solomon and the fame of the queen of the South. This generation had the opportunity to hear not just natural or moral wisdom, but also spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus himself, who is the wisdom of God. The queen of the South's conduct will serve as evidence against them, further aggravating their condemnation.

In this passage, Jesus speaks of someone greater than Solomon and the queen of the South who will rise up in judgment with the men of this generation. This more that will rise is something beyond what has been seen before, surpassing both the wisdom of Solomon and the fame of the queen. This generation had the opportunity to hear not just natural or moral wisdom, but also spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus himself, making their condemnation even greater.

Someone greater than Solomon and the queen of the South will rise up in judgment with the men of this generation. This more that will rise is something beyond what has been seen before, surpassing both the wisdom of Solomon and the fame of the queen. This generation had the opportunity to hear not just natural or moral wisdom, but also spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus himself, making their condemnation even greater.

In Luke 11:31, it is said that she shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them. Her conduct would be brought as an evidence against them, and be improved as an aggravation of their condemnation. The sign given to this generation is something greater than what attracted the queen of the south, who came to hear only natural or moral wisdom from Solomon. In contrast, this generation had the opportunity to hear spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus, who is the wisdom of God and our Savior.

In this passage, it is said that she shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them. The sign given to this generation is greater than what attracted the queen of the south, who came to hear only natural or moral wisdom from Solomon. This generation had the opportunity to hear spiritual and heavenly wisdom from Jesus, who is the wisdom of God and our Savior.
